trans-unit.source: The Check Group Membership operation is performed by invoking the <embeddedLabel>IsMemberOf</embeddedLabel> function on the directory service.
trans-unit.target: The Check Group Membership operation is performed by invoking the <embeddedLabel>IsMemberOf</embeddedLabel> function on the directory service.

trans-unit.source: This function returns a <languageKeyword>Boolean</languageKeyword> value that indicates whether a specified user, group, or contact is a member of a specified group.
trans-unit.target: This function returns a <languageKeyword>Boolean</languageKeyword> value that indicates whether a specified user, group, or contact is a member of a specified group.

trans-unit.source: The operation is transitive, that is, if User A is a member of Group B and Group B is a member of Group C and the function is invoked with User A and Group C as parameters, it will return <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The operation is transitive, that is, if User A is a member of Group B and Group B is a member of Group C and the function is invoked with User A and Group C as parameters, it will return <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: You can contrast this with the <embeddedLabel>memberOf</embeddedLabel> navigation property for User A, which is intransitive and would therefore not return Group C in its result set because User A is a member of Group C only through its membership in Group B.
trans-unit.target: You can contrast this with the <embeddedLabel>memberOf</embeddedLabel> navigation property for User A, which is intransitive and would therefore not return Group C in its result set because User A is a member of Group C only through its membership in Group B.

trans-unit.source: The request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <parameterReference>mytenantdomain</parameterReference> with the domain of your Azure Active Directory tenant, such as <parameterReference>contoso.onmicrosoft.com</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: Replace <parameterReference>mytenantdomain</parameterReference> with the domain of your Azure Active Directory tenant, such as <parameterReference>contoso.onmicrosoft.com</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> query string parameter is required.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>api-version</parameterReference> query string parameter is required.

trans-unit.source: The examples in this topic use the tenant domain to address the tenant.
trans-unit.target: The examples in this topic use the tenant domain to address the tenant.

trans-unit.source: For other ways of addressing the tenant, see <link xlink:href="5b0f3e3d-f96e-4b5b-864d-fc7c6b185097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Addressing Aliases</link>.
trans-unit.target: For other ways of addressing the tenant, see <link xlink:href="5b0f3e3d-f96e-4b5b-864d-fc7c6b185097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Addressing Aliases</link>.

trans-unit.source: A bearer token issued by Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: A bearer token issued by Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: See <legacyLink xlink:href="874839d9-6de6-43aa-9a5c-613b0c93247e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Scenarios for Azure AD</legacyLink> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <legacyLink xlink:href="874839d9-6de6-43aa-9a5c-613b0c93247e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authentication Scenarios for Azure AD</legacyLink> for more information.

trans-unit.source: The media type of the content in the request body.
trans-unit.target: The media type of the content in the request body.

trans-unit.source: The length of the request in bytes.
trans-unit.target: The length of the request in bytes.

trans-unit.source: The parameters to the function: <parameterReference>groupId</parameterReference>, the object ID of the group to check, and <parameterReference>memberId</parameterReference>, the object ID of the contact, group, or user to check for membership in the specified group.
trans-unit.target: The parameters to the function: <parameterReference>groupId</parameterReference>, the object ID of the group to check, and <parameterReference>memberId</parameterReference>, the object ID of the contact, group, or user to check for membership in the specified group.

trans-unit.source: The following sample request checks the membership of the specified object in the specified group.
trans-unit.target: The following sample request checks the membership of the specified object in the specified group.

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code <embeddedLabel>200 OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code <embeddedLabel>200 OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The identifier for the server that performed the requested operation.
trans-unit.target: The identifier for the server that performed the requested operation.

trans-unit.source: The key that identifies the current session with the directory service.
trans-unit.target: The key that identifies the current session with the directory service.

trans-unit.source: The following sample response is received when the sample request above is sent.
trans-unit.target: The following sample response is received when the sample request above is sent.

trans-unit.source: It indicates that the specified member object is a member of the specified group.
trans-unit.target: It indicates that the specified member object is a member of the specified group.
